# Short Bio

<span style="font-size: 14pt"/span>**Merim Bilalić** <span style="font-size: 14pt"/span> is Professor of Cognitive Psychology at Northumbria University, Newcastle. He received his DPhil in Experimental Psychology from Oxford University, and has held research and teaching positions at Humboldt University, Brunel University, Tübingen University, and Klagenfurt University. In 2008, Merim Bilalić was recognized for his doctoral research on the (in)flexibility of experts with the [Award for the Outstanding Doctoral Research Contribution to Psychology](https://www.bps.org.uk/award-outstanding-doctoral-research-contributions-psychology) from the British Psychological Society. The following year, his psychological research on chess expertise was honored with the [Scientific Award of the Karpow Chess Academy](https://de.chessbase.com/post/wienschaftspreis-der-ksa-fr-merim-bilalic). His latest book, [The Neuroscience of Expertise](https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/the-neuroscience-of-expertise/CA92349C4DDFF183B609C202775FBED0), was published by Cambridge University Press in 2017. He holds the [FIDE Chess Master title](https://ratings.fide.com/profile/14401118) and was the junior (U20) champion of Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1996.
